custom-action.name: aws_cloudwatch_monitoring
custom-action.description:
Monitors AWS CloudWatch
AWS URL : Endpoint to access the AWS metrics to trace. This endpoint defines the region to retrieve. http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#cw_region for complete list of endpoints. Example : https://monitoring.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com for Ireland region
accessKey: Access Key to connect to your AWS account Example : AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE
secretKey: Secret Access Key generated from the AWS IAM console Example : wJalrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY
(optional) Period : Granularity, in minutes, of the returned datapoints. Detailed monitoring in AWS lets you have all your metrics with one minute granularity. Basic monitoring limits the following EC2 metrics to a 5-minute granularity : - CPUUtilization - DiskReadBytes - DiskReadOps - DiskWriteBytes - DiskWriteOps - NetworkIn - NetworkOut Default value : 1
(optional) Offset : Number of minutes to retrieve from the AWS monitoring on each request Default value : 6
(optional) Metric Name : Filter on the metric to retrieve. Possible options are : - CPUUtilization - DiskReadBytes - DiskReadOps - DiskWriteBytes - DiskWriteOps - NetworkIn - ... Default value : None
(optional) Data Exchange API client : hostname of the controller Default Value : localhost
Execution time of this custom action depends on the number of counters available for your credentials in AWS. To be sure to have no gap in your monitoring, you need to : - Make sure you set a pacing for the action container, equal to the Offset - Make sure the execution time of this action is faster than the Offset
